node.title: Peres Jepchirchir of Kenya wins the women’s race at the New York City Marathon.
node.alt: Peres Jepchirchir, left, and Viola Cheptoo on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan.
node.description: Jepchirchir’s victory comes just three months after she won gold in the women’s marathon at the Tokyo Olympics.
node.content: ["In a dramatic finish to the women\u2019s race at the New York City Marathon on Sunday, Peres Jepchirchir of Kenya pulled away in the final meters to win, just three months after she won gold in the women\u2019s marathon at the Tokyo Olympics.", "Jepchirchir finished in 2 hours 22 minutes 39 seconds, just four seconds ahead of Viola Cheptoo, also of Kenya. (Cheptoo is the runner Bernard Lagat\u2019s younger sister.) Ababel Yeshaneh of Ethiopia finished third. Molly Seidel, who won bronze at the Olympics in August, finished fourth as the top American.", ""]
